column11: Review Text

column8: In search of a mythical king
column11: Folklore of India and Sri Lanka talk about an all powerful mythical king called Ravana who travelled around in a flying machine called the "Dandumonara". In folklore, Thotupola, as the literal name suggests is said to be the place where this this machine was parked. Thotupola is the third highest mountain in Sri Lanka and the hike to it's summit is the easiest  out of the trails in the Horton Plains Forest Reserve. You will come to the trail entrance a couple of hundred meters after you pass the Pattipola entrance and move towards the famous Horton plains trail entrance. There is a sign board indicating the place. It's a 2 km (one way) relatively easy hike with very little elevation gain. The round trip including photo stops took us 2 hours. But then again, my legs were feeling like jelly after a more strenuous hike the day before, so we pretty much moved at the pace of sloths. There is a clear path right to the top. But in certain places the path can get very narrow, sandwiched between thick shrub jungle on both sides. So it's advisable to be fully covered to avoid being scratched from tree branches. A hiking stick would also be useful to pave the way when the shrubs become too thick. The vegetation is quite different from the Horton plains trail. Here you mostly walk through a scrub jungle (a plus on a sunny day though) and there are only couple of open areas where you would get a nice view of the surrounding areas. The day we visited, there was a heavy mist, so even the open areas didn't offer much of a view. The supposed summit (assuming what we thought as the summit was the actual summit) is a bit of an anti climax being marked by a telecommunications tower and covered in shrub jungle, hence offering no views. Its better to remember that the highlight of this trail is the journey and not the end destination.... On the subject of lepords...... Post corona, Horton Plains had had increased sightings of leopards. At the Pattipola entrance ticket counter, we were told not to get down from the vehicle until we got to the Horton plains trail car park which is 5kms away, due to the presence of leopards. However when we told them that we would be taking the Thotupola trail which would basically require us to get down from the vehicle on the path between the ticket counter and the main car park they said that was perfectly fine....! At the entrance to the Thotupola trail there was another sign warning about the presence of leopards. We were a little apprehensive at first since there were only 2 of us. But another group of 4 boys joined us at the trail. Plus it was a long weekend and the route to the main Horton plains trail was quite busy with vehicular traffic.  So, our advice would be to either go with a large group or in a really busy period. There is not much parking space at the entrance to this trail, but you can generally manage to park there since not many people take this trail. [While the ticket office will tell you to park only at the main car park, those who take this trail will be allowed to park at its entrance.] Surprisingly, there were also two newly built, very clean washrooms at the entrance to the trail. The park opens at 6 am but there are separate closing times for each trail. Do check those before visiting. I love any and every kind of hike and loved this hike as much as any other one I have taken. Also loved the misty weather even if it meant no stunning views. But objectively, this hike is neither as adventurous as the Kirigalpotta hike nor as picturesque as the horton plains trail (all in the same Forest Reserve), hence the four star rating.

Thotupola kanda is a third highest peak in Sri Lanka. It’s a 2km hike with a beautiful scenery on top . On the peak it’s a fantastic scenery with mist clouding around you on and off . On the way if you are lucky you can spot leopards of the cloud forest . Path is not difficult and it will take about 2hrs to climb up and down .

It is not a hard hike to top of the mountain. But there are so much trees and bushes every where. Forest is so thik and don't go out of the road. Never hike alone or walk at night. This is one of the greatest lepord kingdom at Horton Plains.

column8: Not that difficult but breath taking hike …
column11: One of the best pace to do hiking during February to May, beautiful scenic and flowers,view Sripada in morning hours ….!

column8: A must do in Horton Plains
column11: We climbed with mild rain with a 02 year old and 06 year old. Challenging for the kids but good fun...
Amazing and also very beautiful nature friendly place for all my lovely travellers arround the world.
Go in the forest range and you will be in a good mood to think about a changing life style with a huge innovative way

column8: 3rd Highest mountain peak in Sri Lanka
column11: You can get an amazing view from the top of this mountain. The entrance is from the Horton Plains, Nuwara Eliya. This has a very historical importance since King Ravana. This hike will only take maximum 40 minutes to reach the summit. Weather is bit cold. You can visit Kirigalpotha on the same day which is the 2nd highest mountain peak in the country

Thotupola mountain is one of the highest among top ten. It will take a half a day to climb and sightseeing . There is a different plant habitat and many more to see. We can see lot of mountains at the top. One of the most beautiful mountain range of Sri lanka can be seen there. It also have a historical connection to King Rawana Era.

So if you are going here, please make sure to get there as early as 6-7 am. We made the mistake of getting there later (mid day) and it was all misty. Though the forest trail was very enjoyable when we were heading to the top it was very windy and covered in mist ( we enjoyed it nevertheless) I would not encourage toddlers / children under the age of 10 as the way to the top will have grass reaching your waist or taller. do not wear shorts, you may bruise yourself. wear long thicker trousers. Due to the time we got to the top we could view anything. but the treck itself was very enjoyable. if you take a small snack with you, there are small patches where you can lie down and enjoy. in the event you do decide to take children under the age of 10, its best for an adult to scope when you arrive at the narrow route with tall glades and then decide if the children could make it through. If the kids are well seasoned travel enthusiasts, they will enjoy the trail further uphill. You can always turn back if the going gets tough!

We started the climb around 11am and whether was great but better be prepared since it can change without any notices so better be prepared and once you reach to the summit it's breath taking 360 degree views hope you will love it too
Thitupola kanda is like 2 Km hike from the carb park You have can start the hike easily from Horton plains

Quite close to the entrance gate and is one of the more easier hikes to the 3rd highest mountain in Sri Lanka. Walking through the bushes in the mist is an absolutely amazing expireince. But its too bad that there is no realy view at the top mostly due to the heavy mist.
Easy hike, but views are stunning once you got in to on top of Thotupola Kanda which is the third highest mountain in Sri Lanka.
its not hard at all. it has a perfect trail and very beautiful view of hortan plains entrance and other area. Leapod activities are much higher . but its so hard to spot one.

Amazing and serene. This trail is very peaceful and beautiful. You will see some rare birds like the Dull Blue Flycatcher, Sri Lanka Whistling Thrush etc. Also you will see the rare horned lizard found in Horton Plains. If you are lucky you might get a brief glimpse of a leopard.

not a difficult hike , slippery and wet conditions are there but that is part of what makes it what it is. there is no great view when you are at the summit point so don't be dissapointed , the fun is in the hike itself. there are places which provide panoramic views throughout the hike.

Thotupola Kanda is having a historical value in a way people think that this place has used by king Ravana to land his Dadumonaraya (a vehicle that can fly). Train starts few hundred meters from the Pattipola entry gate of Horton Plains. Trail is around 4 km and do not have much hard mountains. Better to keep some water with you since no source available in your way. Nice view can be seen if its not misty at the end of the trail that worth the effort put by you.

This hike is only 4 km RT from the trail head and pretty much easy. The trail continuously climbs until the peak through dense forests. This is Sri Lanka's 3rd highest mountain and doing it in 2 km is so awesome right? Do not think, just do it!!!
